item.title: Graffiti on wall alongside St Georges Road (opposite #125), 16th February
item.description:
There is multiple Graffiti on the wall / fence alongside St Georges Road (opposite / other side of the road from 125 / 119 St Georges Road, Cheltenham). There are 4 instances of Graffiti along this section.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Georges Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large area of badly patch road, cars are slowing to a crawl to go over it or swerving onto the wrong side of the road. This doesnt need patching again, it needs the whole area taking up and fixing properly. Extremely dangerous for cyclists., 16th February
item.description:
Just where the road widens, you cant miss it. The whole area, probably something like 4mx2m, needs fixing properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Greenhills Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on building St Georges Road opposite top of Great Western Terrace, 16th February
item.description:
There is multiple Graffiti on an electrical sub-station St Georges Road opposite top of Great Western Terrace. The substation is next to a footpath that leads from St Georges Road to the Honeybourne Path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Georges Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rattling manhole ineffective repair, 16th February
item.description:
This is an update to reports 8334336 and 8665654. Contractors visited to supposedly repair this manhole cover. All they did was put tarmac on top of it. All this achieved was to make it go 'clunk clunk' instead of 'clack clack' every time a vehicle goes over it. This was a waste of taxpayers money and the contractor should be required to fix it correctly at their own expense.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 16th February
item.description:
Nice try closing my previous ticket. This road is in such a state and yet you say the problem is addressed? The problem will be addressed either when a car's tyre/suspension explodes going over this embarrassment of a road or when it's fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Hayden Road, Hesters Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised private road sign, 16th February
item.description:
Branch lane was always a public road/lane,a private road sign was erected in the 1980s without any notification to neighbours whose access through the road was necessary.There is no evidence of Stopping up on,and the road is not owned by by anyone.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Branch Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 16th February
item.description:
Customer reports that the One-Way sign at the location has been turned 180 degrees, which is confusing motorists. They are concerned that there will be an accident.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: A significant area of carriageway failure, 16th February
item.description:
This pothole area has clearly been inspected but the paint markings indicate that only the edge will be repaired: this is ridiculous as the photo clearly shows a significant area of carriageway failure, all of which needs digging out to a sound foundation, backfilling (preferably with concrete because of the amount of water, and THEN blacktopped. The paint markings indicate that the potholes by the edge of the carriageway will be filled but they'll then need doing again .... ridiculous and a complete waste of limited funds!!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Tewkesbury, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water issuing from maintenance cover on cycleway, 16th February
item.description:
Water rising from this maintenance access is running across the cycleway and footpath. It suggests a blocked drain. What3words location: ///matter.bump.posed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 414, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris from trees/ silt and runoff, 16th February
item.description:
